citation.article-title: Bacillus thiaminolyticus sp. nov., nom. rev.

p.s: Description of Bacillus thiaminolyticus sp. nov., nom. rev.
Bacillus thiaminolyticus (thi.am.in.o.ly'tic.us. M. L. n. thiamina, thiamine; M. L. adj. lyticus, dissolving; M. L. adj. thiaminolyticus, decomposing thiamine)
Rods that are 0.5 to 1.0 by 2.0 to 3.0 μm.
Gram positive.
Motile.
Ellipsoidal spores are formed in swelling sporangia.
Agar colonies are nonpigmented, translucent, thin, smooth, circular, entire, and 1.0 to 2.0 mm in diameter
Catalase and oxidase are produced.
Facultatively anaerobic.
Acetylmethylcarbinol and hydrogen sulfide are not produced.
Indole is produced.
The pH in Voges-Proskauer broth (test for acetylmethylcarbinol production) ranges from 4.9 to 5.5.
Nitrate is usually reduced to nitrite.
Starch and casein are hydrolyzed.
Urea, Tween 80, and egg yolk lecithin are not decomposed.
Arginine, lysine, ornithine, and phenylalanine are not decomposed.
Tyrosine is degraded.
Acetate, citrate, fumarate, malate, and succinate are utilized.
No growth occurs at pH 5.6 or 5.7.
No change occurs in litmus milk in 7 days.
Most strains grow in the presence of 5% NaCl; no growth occurs in the presence of 7% NaCl.
Growth is not inhibited by 0.001% lysozyme.
The optimum growth temperature is 28°C; the maximum temperature for growth is 45°C; and the minimum temperature for growth is 20°C.
Acid, but no gas, is produced from cellobiose, D-fructose, D-galactose, D-glucose, lactose, maltose, D-mannose, melibiose, D-ribose, salicin, sucrose, and trehalose.
Variable acid production is observed with L-arabinose, D-mannitol and D-sorbitol.
No acid is produced from L-rhamnose and D-xylose.
The DNA buoyant density is 1.7055 to 1.7075 g/cm3; the G+C content is 52 to 54 mol%.
Isolated from human fecal material and honey bee larvae.
The ability to decompose thiamine is a unique characteristic of this species.
The type strain, strain NRRL B-4156, has been deposited in the Agricultural Research Culture Collection at the Northern Regional Research Center, Peoria, Ill.
